metadata.title: CVE-2021-47293 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  net/sched: act_skbmod: Skip non-Ethernet packets  Currently tcf_skbmod_act() assumes that packets use Ethernet as their L2 protocol, which is not always the case.  As an example, for CAN devices:  	$ ip link add dev vcan0 type vcan 	$ ip link set up vcan0 	$ tc qdisc add dev vcan0 root handle 1: htb 	$ tc filter add dev vcan0 parent 1: protocol ip prio 10 \ 		matchall action skbmod swap mac  Doing the above silently corrupts all the packets.  Do not perform skbmod actions for non-Ethernet packets.
